nodes.text: the Tories amazingly can still make a difference.
if fewer than 100 of the 125 Tories who backed Mr Blair had instead voted with Mr Clarke the Prime Minister would have lost
If it is the case that Blair would have lost if fewer than 100 of the 125 Tories who backed him had voted with Mr. Clarke then - they can still make a difference.
A total of 199 MPs voted against early military action while 393 voted for war
125 of the 393 who voted for war were Tories
If 393 voted for war and 199 against war and 125 Tories voted for war then - if fewer than 100 of those Tories who backed war had voted against it the Prime Minister would have lost.
